image.altText: A mother kisses the forehead of her baby in soft window light.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation uncovers allegations of mothers undergoing birth procedures without consent or being medicated with antidepressants and feeling like they've been "spiked", despite saying "No".

title.children: 'They ignored me, a whole room full of people': Women speak out about 'abuse' in the birth suite

image.altText: Believe women sign

props.synopsis: Three weeks on from the senseless murder of Jennifer and Gretl Petelczyc, there continues to be a sense of frustration among those battling family and domestic violence about issues they feel aren't being addressed.

title.children: Three weeks since an act of domestic violence that chilled WA, what has the government done?

image.altText: Large white sign outside the Department of Education offices surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: The mother of a 14-year-old boy who was allegedly threatened with a knife at his school says the WA Education Department has failed to support traumatised students.

title.children: Police investigating after 12-year-old boy allegedly threatened student with knife at WA school

image.altText: Mohammed Saleh

props.synopsis: All professional athletes make sacrifices for the sake of their career, but few will be forced to contend with adversity of the scale faced by Palestine's soccer team.

title.children: As Palestine's soccer team pursues its World Cup dream, players reflect on their motivations

image.altText: An adult blonde male cartoon wearing khakis.

props.synopsis: One Nation published a two-minute video on Friday called 'The State of Queensland' which used Robert Irwin and popular children's character Bluey to mock the state government over perceived failings ahead of the election in October.

title.children: 'Own goal': One Nation mocks Robert Irwin's legal threat to sue over cartoon

image.altText: Bobby Hill celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Bobby Hill takes a mark that will rival teammate Jamie Elliott for mark of the year, as Collingwood attempts to run down a huge deficit against the Kangaroos. Follow live.

title.children: Pies star's mark of the year sparks huge second half comeback against Kangaroos

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Howe puts Magpies in front as Daicos creates another
North's lead down to one goal as Daicos continues to run riot
Pies continue closing in as Hill strikes

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing a cap smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Guy Haymes was allegedly assaulted inside a Manly unit in February of this year and died in hospital in March. NSW Police arrested and charged a man with his murder on Saturday night.

title.children: Man charged with the murder of surfer allegedly bashed inside Sydney unit

image.altText: crowds at circular quay trurn out for final Vivid Sydney drone show

props.synopsis: Organisers announced on social media that the Love Is In The Air drone show would be cancelled on the final night of Vivid due to the weather conditions.

title.children: Vivid Sydney cancels popular drone show 20 minutes before it was due to start

image.altText: Wong smiles slightly, an Australian flag visible behind her.

props.synopsis: Foreign Affairs Minister Penny Wong has labelled the Coalition's decision to rule out setting a 2030 climate target as a move that will increase Australian energy bills and risk further Chinese influence in the Pacific.

title.children: Wong warns of higher energy bills and greater Chinese incursion into Pacific under Coalition climate plans

image.altText: A middle aged man leans over pots and plates in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: Olashinde "Chef Omo" Omotosho's journey has taken him 12,000km from Lagos to Gascoyne Junction, where he's head chef for the small cattle town's only pub.

title.children: How this well-credentialed African chef found a new home in an outback pub

image.altText: An illustration shows a child with long COVID standing at the bottom of a big staircase, looking overwhelmed

props.synopsis: They're losing their formative years to this debilitating disease. But for too many children with long COVID, finding help is a frustrating and traumatic process that leaves them feeling isolated and invisible.

title.children: Kids are losing their formative years to long COVID. They want you to know they're not lying

image.altText: A Victoria Police car is parked in front of a billboard with a Victoria Police uniform close up

props.synopsis: Police believe a group of teenagers with kitchen knives are behind armed robberies on four supermarkets in Melbourne's south-east on Saturday afternoon.

title.children: Police say arrests imminent in wake of armed robberies on four Melbourne supermarkets

image.altText: A man on a bike rides past a wall, with a painting of the olympic rings on it.

props.synopsis: Organisers are putting the finishing touches on a sporting and cultural opus they hope will transform Paris and unite its residents — but for some, the Olympics are an expensive extravagance and something that must be stopped.

title.children: 'Brisbane, show the world what's happening': Paris has an Olympic warning for Australia

props.synopsis: A series of opinion polls have projected that the far-right party National Rally could win the upcoming French elections and be in a position to form the next government.

title.children: Thousands protest against France's far-right party ahead of snap elections

image.altText: A satellite google maps photo of a large house at the edge of forest

props.synopsis: Investigators say they have identified more victims of Herbert Baumeister, who died before he could ever be charged.

title.children: 'If somebody were killing cheerleaders, nobody would rest': Police identify more victims of suspected serial killer

image.altText: A woman in a black shirt points while talking to the camera as a crowd of people stand behind her

props.synopsis: My time in India came to an abrupt end after I held Prime Minister Narendra Modi to account. This is my full story for the first time.

title.children: As a journalist, it's strange to become the story — but in India, I'm not alone

image.altText: composite of two women

props.synopsis: ABC RN's Big Weekend of Books continues with Tim Winton, Stephanie Alexander, Rachel Cusk, Elizabeth McCracken and Bernadette Brennan and many more still to come

title.children: Big Weekend of Books talks magical realism, writing about the absent mother and anxiety in post-pandemic kids

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lucy Sante on waiting until she was 67 to transition
When poet Hugo Williams fell in love with music

image.altText: A giant panda sitting on the grass

props.synopsis: Two new pandas are offered to Adelaide Zoo as beloved pair Wang Wang and Fu Ni are set to return to China in the coming months after 15 years in the southern hemisphere.

title.children: Australia set to become home to two new giant pandas, Chinese premier announces

image.altText: Marcus Stoinis completes a shot as Matthew Cross watches on from behind the stumps

props.synopsis: Australia drops six catches and gives Scotland every chance to win, but holds on to keep England in the T20 World Cup.

title.children: Australia survives massive scare against Scotland to keep England's T20 World Cup hopes alive

image.altText: Photo of a blue and yellow golden fleece service station and restaurant.

props.synopsis: There are probably a few things that come to mind when reminiscing about long road trips across Australia between the 1950s and '70s. Things like overheating cars, AM radio and the unmistakable icon of the Golden Fleece.

title.children: Whatever happened to Golden Fleece, Australia's first oil company?

image.altText: An artist impression of two large 21 storey towers

props.synopsis: The coastal city of Hervey Bay, a three-and-a-half hour drive north of Brisbane, is known for being a popular retirement location, whose residents enjoy a slower pace of life. But that could all change if plans for a $400 million, 21-storey resort are approved.

title.children: This planned luxury resort is endorsed by an Aussie celebrity, but do the residents of a relaxed, beachside city want it?

image.altText: An aerial view of houses in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The state government said Victoria has the largest annual population growth of all Australian states, and it needs more than two million additional homes by the 2050s. Here are the suburbs it's proposing to grow.

title.children: The Victorian government has proposed new housing targets for local councils. These are the suburbs expected to boom

image.altText: A composite image of two NSW halfbacks, Nicho Hynes and Mitchell Moses, during State of Origin matches

props.synopsis: The NSW Blues are finalising their team selection for State of Origin Game II, with several spots up for grabs to play in the must-win showdown. Follow live.

title.children: Moses backed to replace Hynes as NSW halfback, Manly suffer four injuries against Dragons

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 63' TRY: Jake Trbojevic scores for Manly
54' TRY: Manly hit the front after slick passing
48' TRY: Lomax scores for the Dragons

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit.

props.synopsis: It's been a year-and-a-half since the charges first came before the courts. Monday will be the first time he has had to appear in person.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann set to appear in Queensland court on two counts of rape

image.altText: Two people standing near a coles basket

props.synopsis: A small Victorian milk company says supermarket giant Coles has removed its products from 65 Victorian stores in retribution for refusing to give the supermarket a bigger profit margin.

title.children: Dairy owners say their milk is vanishing from shelves after they refused Coles's profit margin demands

image.altText: Big Scrub rainforest

props.synopsis: More than 10,000 leaves from 60 plant species found between Far North Queensland and southern NSW are being propagated in a bid to increase the genetic diversity of rainforests.

title.children: Scientists plan to build new generation of 'super trees' to tackle climate change

image.altText: Koraly Dimitriadis leans close to her daughter. Both smiling. Koraly's boyfriend is beside them and a lake is in the background.

props.synopsis: People often think it's odd that my ex is still in our lives, despite not being my partner or my daughter's dad. Five years ago, I would have agreed with them.

title.children: We've never encountered a family like ours — but it works for us

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: You're back to make up for last week's pitiful attempt? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Hoping to end your losing streak? We'll see about that. Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: A boat sits in the ocean with its rear covered by water against a blue sky

props.synopsis: Australia has sent specialised recovery equipment to Fiji to help with the recovery of RFNS Puamau, with Fijian authorities working to prevent any potential oil spill from the accident.

title.children: Fiji works to recover patrol boat that ran aground after being gifted by Australia

image.altText: An Israeli tank driving through a dirt road.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military suffers its largest loss of life in a single incident in months, which could complicate the political situation for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu who is facing protests and calls for a ceasefire deal with Hamas.

title.children: Eight Israeli soldiers and 19 Palestinians killed as fighting continues in Rafah

image.altText: Keiarna in a beanie travelling in front of a a valley with moutnains and clear water

props.synopsis: The cost of living's latest victim could be the Aussie gap year dream, but experts say there are still ways to backpack overseas on the cheap.

title.children: It was once a rite of passage, but now a European summer holiday could be unattainable for young people
